dict.string: please refer to our frequently asked questions (FAQ) by following this link: http://is.gd/QxBphL

if you keep receiving disconnects due to a timeout in Textual, then chances are good that there is an intermediate connection issue between you and the IRC network being connected to. For more information see: http://is.gd/LAhMyQ
it is the official stance of the Textual IRC Client project to NOT support file transfers through DCC. http://is.gd/h8srRm
Textual automatically attempts SASL PLAIN authentication on servers that support it. See this link for more information: http://is.gd/b6ZI0i

please view https://github.com/Codeux/Textual/blob/master/README for information on compiling Textual and be aware that the staff will not provide customer support for forks or self compiled releases.
to submit your feature request please contact support@codeux.com
see this link to learn how to import and export your Textual preferences: http://is.gd/A7VsrF
see this link to learn how to add a new, or override an existing keyboard shortcut in Textual: http://is.gd/pNMMPs
see this link for information on how to write Objective-C plug-ins for Textual: http://is.gd/ZW1MfB
see this link for information on how to write scripts for Textual: http://is.gd/OSptgp
see this link for a list of some of the 3rd party plug-ins, scripts, and styles for Textual: http://is.gd/VK1POm
here is a list of commands that are built into the Textual IRC Client: http://is.gd/FW3q6T
here is a list of keyboard shortcuts that are built into the Textual IRC Client: http://is.gd/87RyD2
if you own a copy of Textual you can sign up to the Textual newsletter to get pre-release copies of Textual at http://is.gd/urItDO
the Textual IRC Client can be downloaded from: http://www.textualapp.com/
the Textual subreddit can be found at /r/textual
the official Textual twitter account can be found at http://twitter.com/Textual

this is a bug that has to do with OS X's rendering of unicode in Mountain Lion and is completely unrelated to textual. Other users are posting certain unicode characters that exploit this error causing a crash. Updating to OS X 10.8.5 or above will fix this issue.

this is a bug introduced in OS X 10.9 Mavericks that has to do with the rendering engine used by Textual. We have notified Apple and they have so far neglected to respond. We are considering workarounds to this issue and in the meantime we appologize for the inconvenience. You can temporarily solve it by doing /clearall.
